Dialogue:
CC: Nice to meet you!
DP: Thank you in advance.
CC: I was wondering what you do when you have time, but I guess you don't have any time, right? Haha.
DP: Since I am on a solo assignment, I have time on weekdays.
CC: I see. Will you spend your time watching videos?
DP: I usually watch videos on YOUTUBE and AMAZON PRIME VIDEO.
CC: I feel the same way.
DP: What kind of things are you watching?
CC: On YouTube, well, it's called Rehack. It's a bit embarrassing to say it, though.
DP: What is that? Please tell me!
CC: It's a program made by Nikkei TV Tokyo, maybe related to politics.
DP: You're not embarrassed at all, are you? Is it a debate-related thing?
CC: No, it's embarrassing to say it since Hiroyuki is here, haha.
DP: Hiroyuki appears everywhere and is often a topic of conversation in our family. My eldest son looks up to him as a mentor.
CC: It's scary to look up to a master, haha.
DP: A cause for concern.
CC: It is a program that makes you feel like you understand a bit more about society.
DP: I'll watch it from now on. I'm looking forward to it.
CC: If there is an opportunity, definitely. I watch anime on Amazon Prime. How about you?
DP: I was watching JOJO until just now.
CC: JOJO! I haven't been following it. Is it the latest series?
DP: No, it's an old one. It takes a lot of effort to watch that. What anime are you watching?
CC: Since it was a hot topic, I recently binge-watched Ya Boy Kongming.
DP: I'm curious about it. Is it interesting?
CC: You can watch it with an empty mind, so it feels good. It's silly and funny.
DP: I want to clear my mind.
CC: If so, please laugh. You can laugh at how silly it is.
DP: Alright, let's watch!!
CC: Please watch the cute Koumei!
DP: Roger. It was fun. Thank you very much.
CC: Thank you very much!

CC: Nice to meet you!  
BL: Nice to meet you.  
CC: Did you do anything that feels like summer?  
BL: Playing with water in the bath.  
CC: Do you have children?  
BL: Yes, I put her in a swimsuit to improve her mood.  
CC: I guess we can't go to the sea or the pool, right?  
BL: This year, we can go, but the pool seems scary.  
CC: Are you afraid of the pool regardless of the coronavirus?  
BL: Due to COVID-19, I have never been to a pool.  
CC: That does sound a bit scary.  
BL: It's good to get used to it while young. I can't swim either.  
CC: I wasn't good at it either. After walking along the beach, I felt like swimming.  
BL: It's amazing if you can swim in the sea!  
CC: But whether I can swim now is uncertain...  
BL: If you could swim before, it should be fine.  
CC: I haven't had the opportunity to swim since becoming an adult.  
BL: It's rare. Even at the sea, most people play on the beach.  
CC: That's true. I haven't ridden a bicycle for about 10 years.  
BL: 10 years is a long time! After a few years, I could ride normally.  
CC: I think I can ride it, but riding on the road makes me nervous.  
BL: It is scary where there are many cars.  
CC: I feel scared when I see a bicycle on the roadway and on the sidewalk.  
BL: Sidewalks separated for bicycles and pedestrians are safer.  
CC: Yes, that's better.  
BL: More separated sidewalks would be reassuring.  
CC: When I got off at Kawasaki Station, I saw many sections for bicycles.  
BL: Regions vary in advancement.  
CC: I think so too.  
BL: I hope more places will improve.

CC: Nice to meet you.  
BL: Hello, nice to meet you too.  
CC: What do you usually do when you have free time?  
BL: I usually check social media.  
CC: Is it something like Instagram?  
BL: I mainly use Twitter.  
CC: Twitter? I also check it sometimes.  
BL: Yes, even though I want to see my acquaintances' tweets, I often see recommended ones.  
CC: Don't you think Twitter's recommendation feature is too frequent?  
BL: Yes, there are many recommendations, often from people I don't know.  
CC: I see a lot of tweets from people I'm not following.  
BL: That's correct. There are many complaints about it.  
CC: I only check Twitter occasionally, so there are a lot of updates piled up.  
BL: Yes, many people update frequently.  
CC: That's true. But I spend more time on Instagram. Do you use Instagram?  
BL: I rarely check Instagram and have to log in again when I do.  
CC: I installed TikTok the other day.  
BL: TikTok has a lot of dancing content.  
CC: I was too young to understand the vibe.  
BL: It seems TikTok might not suit everyone.  
CC: I like dancing, so I thought it might be good, but it was just okay.  
BL: Have you ever danced before?  
CC: Just a little bit when I was a student.  
BL: Dance styles change over time.  
CC: I thought Chocopla, who is also active on TikTok, is a genius.  
BL: Is Chocopla a famous person?  
CC: Do you know the comedians called Chocolate Planet?  
BL: Ah, they are entertainers! It sounds interesting.  
CC: In a TikTok filled with incomprehensible posts, this one was exceptionally nonsensical. Chocopla.  
BL: It seems interesting.  
CC: It was great talking with you!  
BL: Thank you.

CC: Nice to meet you!
BR: Hello. How can I assist you today?
CC: Do you do any exercise?
BR: I haven't been doing much recently. Just walking and doing sit-ups.
CC: Do you go for walks often?
BR: Yes, I used to walk for over an hour a day before it got hot.
CC: Is walking for an hour necessary to see benefits?
BR: Benefits start to show after about 20 minutes.
CC: Really?
BR: Do you do any exercise?
CC: No, but I think walking along the river near my house would be nice.
BR: Is the river close to you? It feels nice to walk by the river.
CC: The strong wind has been a bit concerning lately.
BR: Is the wind strong? Is the river wide?
CC: It’s spacious. The sea is also relatively close.
BR: It seems like the wind is strong there. Our place is more on the mountain side, so the river isn't wide.
CC: Is the current swift then?
BR: No, the currents are calm and soothing to watch.
CC: Watching water flow can be very relaxing.
BR: I agree. Watching from the bridge is nice.
CC: My eyes have been flickering lately.
BR: On sunny days, it is tough without shade on the bridge.
CC: The wind on the bridge is also quite strong, isn’t it?
BR: It's not strong here, so it's alright.
CC: On windy days, the bridge sways.
BR: Really? That seems scary. It's interesting how different it can be upstream and downstream.
CC: I would like to go on an adventure from the uppermost stream to the sea at least once.
BR: River rafting sounds fun.
CC: I saw an advertisement for that experience before. I'm interested.
BR: Noted. Thank you for sharing that information.

CC: Good evening!
CH: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
CC: Nice to meet you. Did you go out somewhere today?
CH: Today, I only went for a walk after dinner.
CC: Do you walk frequently?
CH: Yes, I walk daily unless it rains. Recently, it rained often.
CC: Every day? The rain finally stopped, didn't it?
CH: Yes, and the mornings and evenings are cooler now.
CC: It was cool this morning too.
CH: The temperature heats up quickly, but it was hot even early morning recently.
CC: How long do you walk for?
CH: About an hour, based on distance.
CC: It's impressive you do it daily. Is there a reason you decided to exercise?
CH: I used to exercise a lot, but after being sick, I lost motivation. Now, I walk.
CC: You must have had good physical strength before.
CH: Yes, I was very energetic, even running late at night.
CC: Running late at night! What time did you start work?
CH: I usually arrived at work around 8:30 AM.
CC: You have a lot of stamina. Just working tires me out.
CH: Being young helped, but things can change with a trigger.
CC: After so much activity, you must sleep well.
CH: Despite that, I experienced sleep paralysis more often.
CC: What causes sleep paralysis?
CH: Common causes are stress and overwork.
CC: It sounds like you were overworking.
CH: In hindsight, it was overdoing it.
CC: Some things are clearer after they pass.
CH: I aim to be careful for better sleep.
CC: Good idea.
CH: Noted.

CC: Good evening!
CH: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
CC: Are you not sleepy yet at this time?
CH: No, I am not.
CC: Do you usually go to bed around midnight?
CH: Yes, typically around midnight. How about you?
CC: I usually go to bed later, around 1 or 2 a.m.
CH: Does that affect your alertness the next day?
CC: Not at the moment since I'm not working. When working, I aim for 1 a.m.
CH: Individual sleep needs can vary.
CC: Genetics may influence being a morning or night person.
CH: Some genes may make night-time more favorable for certain people.
CC: Matsuko Deluxe mentioned being a night owl.
CH: Noted.
CC: A morning person would surprise me.
CH: Sleep duration requirements differ.
CC: Seven hours is optimal for me. How about you?
CH: I need about 8 hours.
CC: Ten hours feels excessive.
CH: Adults typically don't need 10 hours of sleep.
CC: I struggle to wake up if I sleep 10 hours.
CH: As a child in the countryside, I slept more.
CC: Is more sleep common in the countryside?
CH: Generally, yes.
CC: That was unexpected.
CH: There wasn't much to do after dark.
CC: You didn’t visit friends’ houses?
CH: They went home by 5 p.m.
CC: Rural nights are really dark.
CH: It was healthy for children.

CC: Hello, nice to meet you!  
BV: Hi there.  
CC: What do you do on your days off?  
BV: I mostly clean the house.  
CC: Were you able to get everything sorted out?  
BV: Not really, it gets messy again quickly.  
CC: Yeah, that’s understandable. Keeping things tidy can be tough.  
BV: Especially with work taking up time.  
CC: I can relate. I clean on weekends, but it gets messy again by the next one.  
BV: Same here. I wish I could be better at keeping things organized.  
CC: Do you have a fixed day off?  
BV: Sundays.  
CC: So, you work the rest of the week?  
BV: Yes.  
CC: That must be tough. But at least Sundays are good for meeting friends.  
BV: I met up with friends last Sunday.  
CC: I remember when I used to work weekends and holidays, it was hard to find time to see anyone.  
BV: That must have been challenging.  
CC: Yes, it was.  
BV: Were you working in the service industry?  
CC: Yes, since it involved customer service, weekends and holidays were important workdays.  
BV: Got it.  
CC: Having a weekday off is good for running errands when places aren’t crowded.  
BV: Weekday offs can be very useful.  
CC: I think having one weekday off and one weekend day off would be ideal.  
BV: Personal time is definitely important.  
CC: Not having social time can be exhausting.  
BV: Breaks are necessary.  
CC: Breaks are very important.  
BV: I understand. Goodbye.

CC: Hello.
BH: Hello.
CC: Thanks.
BH: You're welcome.
CC: It's raining with intense thunder earlier.
BH: It hasn't rained here.
CC: Really?
BH: Where are you?
CC: Chubu region.
BH: Thunder can be unsettling.
CC: Yesterday was very hot.
BH: It's been very hot recently.
CC: Yes.
BH: I consume many cold things.
CC: Ice cream?
BH: Yes, and juice.
CC: Strong air conditioning feels very cold after sweating.
BH: Yes, air conditioners get very cold.
CC: The company I worked for had extreme temperatures.
BH: That sounds difficult.
CC: Managing temperature was challenging.
BH: Even at 28 degrees, it can feel cold.
CC: 27 degrees feels hot.
BH: It's hard to get it right.
CC: Maybe 27.5 degrees would be good.
BH: We can't set it to that.
CC: Today's temperature is just right.
BH: It might feel cold at home.
CC: I also spend a lot of time indoors.
BH: It's hard to track the outside temperature when indoors.

CC: Nice to meet you.  
BH: Nice to meet you!  
CC: What do you usually do when you have free time?  
BH: I often watch recorded dramas and variety shows.  
CC: Oh, you watch TV!  
BH: I enjoy watching TV a lot.  
CC: I see. What kind of dramas are you watching now?  
BH: The one I like now is called Ishiko and Haneo!  
CC: I'm watching too!  
BH: It’s interesting, isn’t it?  
CC: It's interesting. Oh, was it broadcast today?  
BH: What day was it again? I don’t remember because I watch it on recording.  
CC: It’s tomorrow.  
BH: I see.  
CC: It seems like it was on Friday.  
BH: I see. I look forward to the next episode!  
CC: I found the magical renovation unexpectedly interesting, among the dramas this season.  
BH: I like that too! It’s amazing how much it costs!  
CC: It’s expensive! Indeed.  
BH: It’s beyond my means.  
CC: I didn’t have high expectations, but when I watched it, it was surprisingly interesting.  
BH: I quite like many of Haru’s dramas!  
CC: Indeed. Haru-chan’s dramas often hit the mark.  
BH: I liked the one you were in with Matsushita before! I don’t remember the title, though.  
CC: Haruchan appears in many dramas.  
BH: Right. The lead actor is also in many other works, isn’t he?  
CC: Was it Shotaro Mamiya?  
BH: Yes, recently, I find it harder to remember names.  
CC: I like Shota Mamiya’s slightly goofy roles.  
BH: I enjoy those roles too!

CC: Hello!
BH: Hello.
CC: Do you usually listen to music often?
BH: Yes, I often listen to music while doing housework.
CC: Music is great because you can listen to it while doing other things.
BH: I understand.
CC: I'm chatting with you while playing music even now.
BH: I see. I am currently in silence.
CC: Since I started working from home, I've been playing music all the time.
BH: What kind of music do you listen to?
CC: Mostly Western music, but I also like Kenshi Yonezu.
BH: I like Yonezu. I don't listen to much Western music.
CC: Everyone loves Mr. Yonezu.
BH: Agreed.
CC: How can they create such good music so quickly?
BH: It's impressive, like a god.
CC: It's talent.
BH: You have a strong connection to music.
CC: I write lyrics, compose music, sing, and dance.
BH: The dancing skill is surprising!
CC: I also make videos.
BH: People who can do many things usually excel at them.
CC: I wonder what can't be done.
BH: You're good at talking. Is there anything you're not good at?
CC: I've never seen you talking!
BH: Really?
CC: Are you on TV, Mr. Yonezu?
BH: There hasn't been much appearance. I've only seen a little myself.
CC: I will try to find Yonezu-san talking.
BH: Please enjoy.
